task.title: Directory Builder
task.abstract: A directory is a useful addition to any Customer Community. The Directory Builder is dynamic tool for creating and maintaining these online listings. The application’s design allows the portal users to personalize the directory’s output based on the data elements in the defined object.
task.section: Search Page.Each directory presents its own custom Search Page. The staff user establishes the title, instructional text and searchable fields.
Search Results. The portal user types ahead in the desired search field(s). Search ahead narrows the search to values within the pool of available data. By clicking on results, pills are created.

Pills identify the criteria that will be used to return the directory search results. The pills provide “OR” logic. The result set puts all records that contain the pill value(s). Multiple pills in each row are treated as “ORs.” The rows are added (“AND”) together. The search fields are treated as ANDs. For Example: First Name = John or James; AND Last Name = Smith. Search Results can be refined by removing the pills

Search. Portal user clicks on Search button to expand the Search results to enter new criteria. Search area collapses to display results. Pills are displayed at the top of the page to remind the customer what filter criteria was employed. Pills can be removed to expand result set.
The Search fields are displayed to the portal user and allows them to add the desired criteria. The search fields offer type ahead logic to assist the portal user locate available values.

The Search Result List displays those data elements identified by the staff user during the setup of the Directory.
The number of records displayed is determined by the Display Result variable on the Directory record. If the result set exceeds that number, pagination is employed to allow the portal user to navigate easily.

section.p: A profile modal is rendered by clicking on a record in the Search Result list. The Profile Modal displays all the records detailed in the directories setup.
When enabled, an authenticated portal user will be able to take advantage of these Advanced Options.
Authenticated portal users benefit from advanced directory options. Among these is the ability to see a Contact’s image if they have uploaded one to their online Profile Modal.

task.section: Contact Me. In addition, the staff user can allow an authenticated portal user to message the Contact owner by clicking on an eMail button on the Contact’s Profile modal. When clicked, a message modal opens. The portal user drafts a message in the provided text areas and clicks Send.
task.p: Note: Both the Portal user and the Profile Owner’s Email address field must be populated.
task.section: Update Profile. The staff user may also provide a link on the authenticated portal users own Profile modal to sees the Email button on the portal user’s personal portal modal window, when the Advanced Option is enabled. When clicked, the portal user is redirected to My Profile page to update personal information displayed.
task.p: Note: Organization will need to include the directory fields in the provided field set.
